key_responsibilities: Manage the office’s constituent correspondence program in a timely and thorough manner
Conduct legislative research and draft response letters
Sort, batch and respond to correspondence through Fireside

Manage intern correspondence work
Support the legislative team with various assignments
being a secondary driver to the Member

Draft briefing materials for the Congressmember
Perform other administrative tasks as needed

strong organizational skills
attention to detail
the ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: assisting the technology needs of Committee staff
editing and maintaining the Committee’s website
answering telephones
assisting with the tracking and processing of committee correspondence
providing administrative support in setting up committee meetings
entering data and navigating databases with accuracy

excellent organizational skills and a professional telephone manner
good computer skills
proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
ability to use good judgment in responding to inquiries and requests

experience or interest in learning information technology assistance

key_responsibilities: draft legislation
analyze bills
meet with constituents concerning policy matters
requirements: libertarian or classical liberal in the tradition of F.A. Hayek, Henry Hazlitt, and Frédéric Bastiat
strong commitment to individual liberty, economic freedom, the Rule of Law, and the Constitution
excellent writer and clear thinker willing to take on the most serious impediments to a freer, more prosperous America
JD or equivalent
Two years of relevant policy experience is preferred

well organized

key_responsibilities: answer the telephones
greet visitors to the office
answer constituent requests for general information, tours, and other inquiries
monitor delivery and pickup of materials
maintain front office
assist with various administrative and legislative duties
answers and screens telephone calls for the Member and other staff members and takes messages
greets and screens visitors
assists persons who have appointments with the Member or other staff members
responds to constituent requests for flags, tours and other information
maintains handout literature regarding the district and the House

logs in mail

key_responsibilities: oversee all operations of the district offices
development and implementation of policy objectives, strategies and operating plans
direct all activities and staff of the district offices
recruiting, hiring, training, and managing district staff
ensures that district staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures
represents the Member and/or assigns appropriate staff to do so at events or functions through the district as needed
strategizing, developing, and implementing district communications and outreach plan for constituents
casework management
serves as the primary liaison between the Congresswoman and constituents and special interest groups in the district
acts as an advisor for the Congresswoman on local concerns, district issues and politics, and other developments throughout the region
requirements: minimum of 3-5 years of management experience
strong ability to provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage a Congressional office
excellent oral and written communication skills
thorough knowledge of the legislative process
energetic, detail-oriented, able to multi-task, politically astute, and willing to work long hours (including evenings and weekends) in a fast-paced and demanding setting

monitoring legislative developments in-portfolio within committees and on the House floor
writing floor speeches for the Member
drafting constituent correspondence
meeting with constituents and advocacy groups on behalf of the Member
other assigned tasks

ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with occasional non-traditional work hours
familiarity with the scope and duties of the House legislative process
strong writing, interpersonal, self-motivation, and organizational skills

at least five years of legislative experience, including management experience
